description.narrative: Project Title :  ‘Grassroots Human Rights Education and Advocacy’. Aim- EQMM aims to build up a strong network of organizations and activists across different sectors and levels of Myanmar Society. Objective- In the upcoming five year period EQMM will increase its efforts to address the need for basic human rights education for civil society actors and people in areas with little access to information and education. This education approach will be complimented by activities aimed at building civil society actors’ knowledge and skills to engage with different levels of government and state institutions. Problem Analysis: Currently, the most pressing human rights concerns and greatest threats to democratization include religious intolerance/discrimination and communal violence; land grabbing and other violations of land and labor rights, particularly as a result of incoming development projects; restrictions on freedom of assembly, restrictions on press freedom/freedom of expression, and lack of access to basic resources and services (housing, employment, education, etc.) in rural areas, particularly in conflict zones.   Expected results; With every completed training, the community of people within Myanmar who respect and understand human rights grows, moving one step closer to EQMM’s goal of building a national culture of human rights. Main Activities-This project will support EQMM’s efforts to provide participatory human rights education while also effectively channeling the concerns and issues from a grassroots level into spheres of authority and duty-holding. With the incoming new NLD government, EQMM hopes to take advantage of working with a more receptive government to advocate for human rights and extend the reach of its human rights education.  Main Thematic- Human Rights
This project mainly contributes to results within Empowerment of human rights defenders. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
